document.topic_text: Yorktown's Maddie Silk belts a homer against Washington-Lee. Posted: Sunday, April 24, 2016 8:52 am | Updated: 9:04 am, Sun Apr 24, 2016. The host Yorktown Patriots (4-8) topped the Washington-Lee Generals (5-10) by an 8-4 score in the annual Breast Cancer Awareness girls high school softball game supporting the Sharon McGowan Breast Health Fund. This year, the team raised $3,000 through donations at the game, a bake sale and a raffle. Yorktown scored a run in the fifth inning and four more in the sixth to win. Maddie Silk (three hits) smacked a pair of two-run homers for Yorktown and Evie Marceca (three hits) homered as well and had a bases-loaded single. Bryanna Lansing had two hits for Yorktown and Kate Cressey had a hit. Silk allowed two hits and two earned runs and fanned seven in six innings to get the win. For W-L, Sydney Rood doubled and outfielder Bailey Jenkins made two good catches. Hallie Kowalski struck out 10 in defeat and had a hit and an RBI. Sara Brown and Audrey Bartz had hits for W-L. * The previous week in softball action,host Yorktown fought back from early deficits and defeated the Fairfax Rebels, 6-5, in walk-off fashion. For the second time in two games, the Patriots fell behind 3-0 in the top of the first inning. Yorktown fought back in the second inning when senior Madeline Marshall knocked in a run following a Cressey double. Sarah Strickland later singled, cutting the lead to 3-2. Fairfax scored a run in the top of the fifth, but in bottom half of the inning, Silk belted a three-run homer to put Yorktown ahead, 5-4. Fairfax scored again in the top of the sixth. In the bottom of the seventh, Strickland singled to lead off the inning, followed by a walk to Camryn Marino. With two outs, Silk singled to left driving home the game-winning run. Silk was also the winning pitcher, tossing seven innings allowing six hits, three earned runs with four strikeouts. In a previous game, Cressey had two RBI in a loss to McLean, and Marino and Silk each had two hits in the contest. In a loss to Hayfield, Silk was 3-4 with a home run and three RBI and pitched six innings. She allowed three hits, two earned runs, and fanned eight. Evie Marceca hit her first career home run. In a 3-2 loss to Langley, Lansing, Lindsay Smith and Cressey had hits, along with two hits from Silk and two RBI from Marshall. Discuss Print Posted in Sports , Arlington , Washington Lee , Yorktown , Softball on Sunday, April 24, 2016 8:52 am. Updated: 9:04 am. Rules of Conduct 1 Keep it Clean.
